trans-unit.source: Map DirectX 9 features to DirectX 11 APIs
trans-unit.target: Map DirectX 9 features to DirectX 11 APIs

trans-unit.source: Understand how the features your Direct3D 9 game uses will translate to Direct3D 11 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
trans-unit.target: Understand how the features your Direct3D 9 game uses will translate to Direct3D 11 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

trans-unit.source: Map DirectX 9 features to DirectX 11 APIs
trans-unit.target: Map DirectX 9 features to DirectX 11 APIs

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Important changes from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Important changes from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Understand how the features your Direct3D 9 game uses will translate to Direct3D 11 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
trans-unit.target: Understand how the features your Direct3D 9 game uses will translate to Direct3D 11 and the Universal Windows Platform (UWP).

trans-unit.source: [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) is still the foundation of DirectX graphics, but the API has changed since DirectX 9:
trans-unit.target: [Direct3D](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh309466) is still the foundation of DirectX graphics, but the API has changed since DirectX 9:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) is used to set up graphics adapters.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) is used to set up graphics adapters.

trans-unit.source: Use [DXGI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh404534) to select buffer formats, create swap chains, present frames, and create shared resources.
trans-unit.target: Use [DXGI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh404534) to select buffer formats, create swap chains, present frames, and create shared resources.

trans-unit.source: A Direct3D device context is used to set pipeline state and generate rendering commands.
trans-unit.target: A Direct3D device context is used to set pipeline state and generate rendering commands.

trans-unit.source: Most of our samples use an immediate context to render directly to the device; Direct3D 11 also supports multithreaded rendering, in which case deferred contexts are used.
trans-unit.target: Most of our samples use an immediate context to render directly to the device; Direct3D 11 also supports multithreaded rendering, in which case deferred contexts are used.

trans-unit.source: See [Introduction to a Device in Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476880).
trans-unit.target: See [Introduction to a Device in Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476880).

trans-unit.source: Some features have been deprecated, most notably the fixed function pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Some features have been deprecated, most notably the fixed function pipeline.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of Direct3D 11 features, see [Direct3D 11 Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476342) and [Direct3D 11 Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh404562).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of Direct3D 11 features, see [Direct3D 11 Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476342) and [Direct3D 11 Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh404562).

trans-unit.source: [Direct2D (Windows)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd370990) is still an important part of DirectX graphics and Windows.
trans-unit.target: [Direct2D (Windows)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd370990) is still an important part of DirectX graphics and Windows.

trans-unit.source: You can still use Direct2D to draw 2D games, and to draw overlays (HUDs) on top of Direct3D.
trans-unit.target: You can still use Direct2D to draw 2D games, and to draw overlays (HUDs) on top of Direct3D.

trans-unit.source: Direct2D runs on top of Direct3D; 2D games can be implemented using either API.
trans-unit.target: Direct2D runs on top of Direct3D; 2D games can be implemented using either API.

trans-unit.source: For example, a 2D game implemented using Direct3D can use orthographic projection, set Z-values to control the drawing order of primitives, and use pixel shaders to add special effects.
trans-unit.target: For example, a 2D game implemented using Direct3D can use orthographic projection, set Z-values to control the drawing order of primitives, and use pixel shaders to add special effects.

trans-unit.source: Since Direct2D is based on Direct3D it also uses DXGI and device contexts.
trans-unit.target: Since Direct2D is based on Direct3D it also uses DXGI and device contexts.

trans-unit.source: The [DirectWrite](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd368038) API adds support for formatted text using Direct2D.
trans-unit.target: The [DirectWrite](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/dd368038) API adds support for formatted text using Direct2D.

trans-unit.source: D3DX and DXUT are deprecated and cannot be used by UWP games.
trans-unit.target: D3DX and DXUT are deprecated and cannot be used by UWP games.

trans-unit.source: These helper libraries provided resources for tasks such as texture loading and mesh loading.
trans-unit.target: These helper libraries provided resources for tasks such as texture loading and mesh loading.

trans-unit.source: The [Simple port from Direct3D 9 to UWP](walkthrough--simple-port-from-direct3d-9-to-11-1.md) walkthrough demonstrates how to set up a window, initialize Direct3D, and do basic 3D rendering.
trans-unit.target: The [Simple port from Direct3D 9 to UWP](walkthrough--simple-port-from-direct3d-9-to-11-1.md) walkthrough demonstrates how to set up a window, initialize Direct3D, and do basic 3D rendering.

trans-unit.source: The [Simple UWP game with DirectX](tutorial--create-your-first-metro-style-directx-game.md) walkthrough demonstrates common game programming tasks including graphics, loading files, UI, controls, and sound.
trans-unit.target: The [Simple UWP game with DirectX](tutorial--create-your-first-metro-style-directx-game.md) walkthrough demonstrates common game programming tasks including graphics, loading files, UI, controls, and sound.

trans-unit.source: The [DirectX Tool Kit](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=248929) community project offers helper classes for use with Direct3D 11 and UWP apps.
trans-unit.target: The [DirectX Tool Kit](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=248929) community project offers helper classes for use with Direct3D 11 and UWP apps.

trans-unit.source: Move shader programs from FX to HLSL
trans-unit.target: Move shader programs from FX to HLSL

trans-unit.source: The D3DX utility library (D3DX 9, D3DX 10, and D3DX 11), including Effects, is deprecated for UWP.
trans-unit.target: The D3DX utility library (D3DX 9, D3DX 10, and D3DX 11), including Effects, is deprecated for UWP.

trans-unit.source: All DirectX games for UWP drive the graphics pipeline using [HLSL](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb509561) without Effects.
trans-unit.target: All DirectX games for UWP drive the graphics pipeline using [HLSL](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb509561) without Effects.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio still uses FXC under the hood to compile shader objects.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio still uses FXC under the hood to compile shader objects.

trans-unit.source: UWP game shaders are compiled ahead of time.
trans-unit.target: UWP game shaders are compiled ahead of time.

trans-unit.source: The bytecode is loaded at runtime, then each shader resource is bound to the graphics pipeline during the appropriate rendering pass.
trans-unit.target: The bytecode is loaded at runtime, then each shader resource is bound to the graphics pipeline during the appropriate rendering pass.

trans-unit.source: Shaders should be moved to their own separate .HLSL files and rendering techniques should be implemented in your C++ code.
trans-unit.target: Shaders should be moved to their own separate .HLSL files and rendering techniques should be implemented in your C++ code.

trans-unit.source: For a quick look at loading shader resources see [Simple port from Direct3D 9 to UWP](walkthrough--simple-port-from-direct3d-9-to-11-1.md).
trans-unit.target: For a quick look at loading shader resources see [Simple port from Direct3D 9 to UWP](walkthrough--simple-port-from-direct3d-9-to-11-1.md).

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11 introduced Shader Model 5, which requires Direct3D feature level 11\_0 (or above).
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11 introduced Shader Model 5, which requires Direct3D feature level 11\_0 (or above).

trans-unit.source: See [HLSL Shader Model 5 Features for Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff471419).
trans-unit.target: See [HLSL Shader Model 5 Features for Direct3D 11](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff471419).

trans-unit.source: Code using XNAMath (or D3DXMath) should be migrated to [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833).
trans-unit.target: Code using XNAMath (or D3DXMath) should be migrated to [DirectXMath](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh437833).

trans-unit.source: DirectXMath includes types that are portable across x86, x64, and ARM.
trans-unit.target: DirectXMath includes types that are portable across x86, x64, and ARM.

trans-unit.source: See [Code Migration from the XNA Math Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee418730).
trans-unit.target: See [Code Migration from the XNA Math Library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee418730).

trans-unit.source: Note that DirectXMath float types are convenient for use with shaders.
trans-unit.target: Note that DirectXMath float types are convenient for use with shaders.

trans-unit.source: For example [**XMFLOAT4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee419608) and [**XMFLOAT4X4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee419621) conveniently align data for constant buffers.
trans-unit.target: For example [**XMFLOAT4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee419608) and [**XMFLOAT4X4**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee419621) conveniently align data for constant buffers.

trans-unit.source: Replace DirectSound with XAudio2 (and background audio)
trans-unit.target: Replace DirectSound with XAudio2 (and background audio)

trans-unit.source: DirectSound is not supported for UWP:
trans-unit.target: DirectSound is not supported for UWP:

trans-unit.source: Use [XAudio2](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405049) to add sound effects to your game.
trans-unit.target: Use [XAudio2](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405049) to add sound effects to your game.

trans-unit.source: Replace DirectInput with XInput and UWP APIs
trans-unit.target: Replace DirectInput with XInput and UWP APIs

trans-unit.source: DirectInput is not supported for UWP:
trans-unit.target: DirectInput is not supported for UWP:

trans-unit.source: Use [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) input event callbacks for mouse, keyboard, and touch input.
trans-unit.target: Use [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225) input event callbacks for mouse, keyboard, and touch input.

trans-unit.source: Use [XInput](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee417001) 1.4 for game controller support (and game controller headset support).
trans-unit.target: Use [XInput](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ee417001) 1.4 for game controller support (and game controller headset support).

trans-unit.source: If you are using a shared code base for desktop and UWP, see [XInput Versions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405051) for information on backwards compatibility.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a shared code base for desktop and UWP, see [XInput Versions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh405051) for information on backwards compatibility.

trans-unit.source: Register for [**EdgeGesture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701600) events if your game needs to use the app bar.
trans-unit.target: Register for [**EdgeGesture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701600) events if your game needs to use the app bar.

trans-unit.source: Use Microsoft Media Foundation instead of DirectShow
trans-unit.target: Use Microsoft Media Foundation instead of DirectShow

trans-unit.source: DirectShow is no longer part of the DirectX API (or the Windows API).
trans-unit.target: DirectShow is no longer part of the DirectX API (or the Windows API).

trans-unit.source: [Microsoft Media Foundation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms694197) provides video content to Direct3D using shared surfaces.
trans-unit.target: [Microsoft Media Foundation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms694197) provides video content to Direct3D using shared surfaces.

trans-unit.source: If your game uses network services, you need to provide networking code that complies with UWP requirements.
trans-unit.target: If your game uses network services, you need to provide networking code that complies with UWP requirements.

trans-unit.source: Win32 and COM for Windows Store apps (networking) (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Win32 and COM for Windows Store apps (networking) (Windows)

trans-unit.source: The following articles help you add networking features and declare support for networking in your app's package manifest.
trans-unit.target: The following articles help you add networking features and declare support for networking in your app's package manifest.

trans-unit.source: Connecting with sockets (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Connecting with sockets (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Connecting with WebSockets (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Connecting with WebSockets (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Connecting to web services (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Connecting to web services (Windows Store apps using C#/VB/C++ and XAML) (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Note that all UWP apps (including games) use specific types of background tasks to maintain connectivity while the app is suspended.
trans-unit.target: Note that all UWP apps (including games) use specific types of background tasks to maintain connectivity while the app is suspended.

trans-unit.source: If your game needs to maintain connection state while suspended see [Networking basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt280233).
trans-unit.target: If your game needs to maintain connection state while suspended see [Networking basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt280233).

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to help convert code from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to help convert code from Direct3D 9 to Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: This can also help distinguish between the device and device context.
trans-unit.target: This can also help distinguish between the device and device context.

trans-unit.source: The graphics pipeline stages are described in [Graphics Pipeline](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476882).
trans-unit.target: The graphics pipeline stages are described in [Graphics Pipeline](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476882).

trans-unit.source: Call [IDXGISwapChain1::Present1](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh446797) with the DXGI_PRESENT_TEST flag set.
trans-unit.target: Call [IDXGISwapChain1::Present1](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh446797) with the DXGI_PRESENT_TEST flag set.

trans-unit.source: LOST device and POOL_MANAGED no longer exist.
trans-unit.target: LOST device and POOL_MANAGED no longer exist.

trans-unit.source: [IDXGISwapChain1::Present1](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh446797) can fail with a [DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb509553) return value.
trans-unit.target: [IDXGISwapChain1::Present1](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/hh446797) can fail with a [DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb509553) return value.

trans-unit.source: The fixed-function pipeline has been deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The fixed-function pipeline has been deprecated.

trans-unit.source: Capability bits are replaced with feature levels.
trans-unit.target: Capability bits are replaced with feature levels.

trans-unit.source: Only a few format and feature usage cases are optional for any given feature level.
trans-unit.target: Only a few format and feature usage cases are optional for any given feature level.

trans-unit.source: These can be checked with [ID3D11Device::CheckFeatureSupport](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476497) and [ID3D11Device::CheckFormatSupport](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb173536).
trans-unit.target: These can be checked with [ID3D11Device::CheckFeatureSupport](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ff476497) and [ID3D11Device::CheckFormatSupport](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/bb173536).

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to convert Direct3D 9 formats into DXGI formats.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to convert Direct3D 9 formats into DXGI formats.

trans-unit.source: Note Use .r swizzle in shader to duplicate red to other components to get Direct3D 9 behavior.
trans-unit.target: Note Use .r swizzle in shader to duplicate red to other components to get Direct3D 9 behavior.

trans-unit.source: Note Use swizzle .rrrg in shader to duplicate red and move green to the alpha components to get Direct3D 9 behavior.
trans-unit.target: Note Use swizzle .rrrg in shader to duplicate red and move green to the alpha components to get Direct3D 9 behavior.

trans-unit.source: Note In Direct3D 9 the data was scaled up by 255.0f, but this can be handled in the shader.
trans-unit.target: Note In Direct3D 9 the data was scaled up by 255.0f, but this can be handled in the shader.

trans-unit.source: Note In Direct3D 9 the data was scaled up by 255.0f, but this can be handled in the shader.
trans-unit.target: Note In Direct3D 9 the data was scaled up by 255.0f, but this can be handled in the shader.

trans-unit.source: Note DXT1 and DXT2 are the same from an API/hardware perspective.
trans-unit.target: Note DXT1 and DXT2 are the same from an API/hardware perspective.

trans-unit.source: The only difference is whether premultiplied alpha is used, which can be tracked by an application and doesn't need a separate format.
trans-unit.target: The only difference is whether premultiplied alpha is used, which can be tracked by an application and doesn't need a separate format.

trans-unit.source: Note DXT3 and DXT4 are the same from an API/hardware perspective.
trans-unit.target: Note DXT3 and DXT4 are the same from an API/hardware perspective.

trans-unit.source: The only difference is whether premultiplied alpha is used, which can be tracked by an application and doesn't need a separate format.
trans-unit.target: The only difference is whether premultiplied alpha is used, which can be tracked by an application and doesn't need a separate format.

trans-unit.source: Note Use .r swizzle in shader to duplicate red to other components to get D3D9 behavior.
trans-unit.target: Note Use .r swizzle in shader to duplicate red to other components to get D3D9 behavior.

trans-unit.source: Note The shader gets UINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed (0.0f, 1.0f... 255.f), UINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.
trans-unit.target: Note The shader gets UINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed (0.0f, 1.0f... 255.f), UINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.

trans-unit.source: Note The shader gets SINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed, SINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.
trans-unit.target: Note The shader gets SINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed, SINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.

trans-unit.source: Note The shader gets SINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed, SINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.
trans-unit.target: Note The shader gets SINT values, but if Direct3D 9 style integral floats are needed, SINT can just be converted to float32 in the shader.

trans-unit.source: Note Requires Feature Level 10.0 or later
trans-unit.target: Note Requires Feature Level 10.0 or later

trans-unit.source: Note Requires Feature Level 10.0 or later
trans-unit.target: Note Requires Feature Level 10.0 or later
